definition: to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to replace (a worn-out tire etc)/to change (one's address etc)
to exchange/to replace/to substitute for/to switch
to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to switch over/to switch modes or data streams/to cut (to a new scene)
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
to transform/to convert/to vary/to alternate/a transformation
to transition to a new dynasty or regime/to replace an older product with an upgraded, new-generation one

sentences.english: They cant change a light bulb or without making a sketch.
sentences.chinese: 他們連燈泡都不會換，或者至少要先畫個草圖。

sentences.english: Take them back and exchange them for another recommended pair of running shoes.
sentences.chinese: 把他們拿回去，拿他們換另外一雙推薦的跑步鞋。

sentences.english: Glasgow I changed trains for Greenock.
sentences.chinese: 我在格拉斯哥換火車去格林諾克。

sentences.english: Perfect husbands switch careers in their mid-50’s.
sentences.chinese: 完美的丈夫在50幾歲換工作。

sentences.english: Peter is a black sheep of his family. He sold his house for drinking.
sentences.chinese: 皮特真是個敗家子，賣了房子換酒錢。

sentences.english: There's no such thing as bad weather, just soft people.
sentences.chinese: 沒有換天氣這回事，只有軟蛋。

sentences.english: Change the Zink block of cathodic Protection.
S: Yes, you can. Bring your card and receipt to replace it at Lao Jie Station.
sentences.chinese: 可以拿收據到老街地鐵站換。

sentences.english: Weiwei is bored with watermelon, so I intend to make some change.
sentences.chinese: 吃了幾天的西瓜，我打算換些喫的餵它。

sentences.english: She blenches at the very thought of changing a baby's dirty nappy.
sentences.chinese: 她一想到給嬰兒換髒尿布就不願意。

sentences.english: I'll ask if that passenger mind moving to another seat.
sentences.chinese: 我去問問那位搭客是否願意換座位。

sentences.english: I also write about gay “cruising, ” which was quite common.
sentences.chinese: 我還寫過關於同性戀換伴侶的事情，那也很普遍。

sentences.english: They're called "daily bracelets " because one may choose a different bracelet for each day of the week.
sentences.chinese: 因爲人們一週中每天可以換一個，所以叫“周鐲”。

sentences.english: Shuck your dirty shirt and put on a new one.
sentences.chinese: 把你的髒襯衣脫了，換一件乾淨的。

sentences.english: Change your socks; they were snagged.
sentences.chinese: 你的襪子挑絲了，換一雙吧。

sentences.english: A glance five hundred years ago gain a shoulder this life .
sentences.chinese: 前生五百次的凝眸，換今生一次的擦肩。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
